reuo.resources.format

Class DataMetrics

  • java.lang.Object
    • reuo.resources.format.DataMetrics

  • public final class DataMetrics
extends Object
    An array with an offset to where valid data begins and a length for how much data is valid. This is used to avoid duplicating arrays and to access Buffers that are backed by an array.
    Author:
    Kristopher Ives, Lucas Green

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      byte[] array
      The underlying array
      int end
      The first index that should not be accessed
      int length
      The number of elements that should be accessed
      int pos
      The position where elements that should be accessed begins

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DataMetrics(byte[] array, int pos, int length)
      Wraps an array with information about the position where data should be accessed and the number of elements that should be accessed.

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • array

        public final byte[] array
        The underlying array

        The position where elements that should be accessed begins

    • Constructor Detail

      • DataMetrics

        public DataMetrics(byte[] array,
           int pos,
           int length)
            throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Wraps an array with information about the position where data should be accessed and the number of elements that should be accessed.
        Parameters:
        array - the array to wrap
        pos - the begining index
        length - the number of elements
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if either the position or length are outisde the bounds of array
